text:
History: This is a 49 y/o man who is presently full code w/NKA with PMH
   of morbid obesity, type 2 DM, and hypertension admitted with shock,
   respiratory failure, and acute renal failure.  Pt found unresponsive by
   wife. Family states for the last few days pt has not been himself &
   progressively getting weaker & not wanting to move as much.  While
   sitting at the edge of bed he became very SOB & family called
   paramedics. Paramedics found him to be in respiratory arrest and then
   was intubated at the scene. Pt was bradycardic & unable to obtain BP
   b/c of the pt's size and  was then given atropine which increased his
   HR.  Pt transferred to OSH ED.  In OSH [**Name (NI) 73**], pt's initial ph was 7.11 w/
   a CO2 of 53, bicarb of 16 & O2 of 225. BUN was 116 & creat 6.5 w/ a K+
   of 8.1. Pt rec'd D50, insulin, kaexalate, and calcium chloride. CKMB 58
   & troponin 0.03.  Dopamine started for pressures in the 70s systolic.
   RIJ dialysis cath placed and pt emergently dialyzed.  Post dialysis K+
   8.0.  Pt also rec
d 1gram vanco & 3.375grams of zosyn. Pt transferred
   to [**Hospital1 19**] MICU.
   Events
 pt receiving CRRT for hyperkalemia and renal failure. System
   clotted within 1
 hrs of onset. Second system taken down within 3 hrs
   of initiation due to ? defect in machine. Attending aware that if
   system went down it would not be restarted as pts renal failure is
   improving. OGT inserted, xray taken to confirm placement. Awaiting
   [**Location (un) **] of film.  Calcium drip continues to infuse for ionized ca of
   [**1-15**] this am.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Pt  with elevated Creat  and hyperkalemia. CPKs elevated.
   Action:
   Treated with CRRT for several hours
   Response:
   Creat down to 3.5. Urine output improving to > 200ccs/hr via foley.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor f+e status closely. ? d/c CRRT.
   Hyperkalemia (high Potassium, Hyperpotassemia)
   Assessment:
   K 5.6 this am after CRRT
   Action:
   Treated with 1 amp d50 and 10 units reg insulin iv
   Response:
   K
   Plan:
   Check lytes freq ( especially glucose, K, ionized ca)
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Received pt on AC 500/28/15/50%/  Fentanyl infusing at 100mcgs/hr and
   versed at 2 mg/hr. Pt initially coughing and restless alarming CRRT
   machine.
   RR  28. LS coarse, diminished at bases.
   Action:
   02 weaned down to 40%. Versed increased to 2.5 mg/hr
   Response:
   Sats > 98%. ABG 7.40/34/150/-[**3-7**] . Pt appeared more comfortable ,
   slept most of the night.
   Plan:
   Continue wean from vent as tolerated. Assess efficacy of pain mgt.
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   Received pt on levophed infusing at .16 mcgs/kg/min.
   Action:
   Levophed titrated down.
   Response:
   Map > 65
   Plan:
   Continue wean from pressors.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   Pt  with multiple areas of skin breakdown, ulcers and yeast.
   Action:
   Wound consult done. Adaptic, dry gauze and kerlix to LLE venous ulcer.
   Antifungal ointment applied to skin folds and coccyx and covered with
   softsorb.  Treated with fluconazole iv. Pt on rotating bed.
   Response:
   Undetermined at this time.
   Plan:
   Wound care as directed. Continue to assess skin integrity.
